result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven E Okan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: This is a time served sentence.
Sixty days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. Submit DNA sample.

9:39 AM Defendant Steven E Okan in court.  Attorney Richard G. Davis Jr. in court for Steven E Okan.  Attorney Jonathan Ross in court for State of Wisconsin. Right to preliminary hearing recited to defendant. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Information filed, reading waived. Agreement recited by State. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Count 2 dismissed and read in. Sentencing statements. Court sentenced the defendant to serve 8 days jail, this is time served sentence with 6 days credit. $518.00 costs. Submit DNA sample. Sixty days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. 9:50 AM
